comment: There is a textbook that you must use to do the required discussion posts weekly. You have to reply to one person a week after you submit it. He isn't a tough grader, as long as you cite the textbook and make clear connections you'll be graded fine. He also allows you to fix your discussions if it is r graded to your liking. There are 10 quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Taking this as an online class over the summer. theres been one quiz and discussion post every week. he gets almost all questions from quizlet. posts/quizzes based on the readings from the book. he'll post the readings for a few weeks, but after that he expects you to have the book. sometimes it isn't necessary to read to complete discuss posts tho

Dr Carter is an amazing, caring instructor; he responds to emails in a timely manner. There are 7-10 quizzes, mid term, 1 assignment, discussion posts with replies and the final. Be ready to read and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: A really reasonable professor if you need help you just have to email him. Not a lot of work or hard work just have to stay on it. highly reccomend taking this course.

The class required weekly discussion post relating to a prompt and then a response to a classmate's post. Weekly readings were interesting. Seven to ten quizzes, a paper, midterm and final were given. Provided weekly feedback and kept you on schedule. The quizzes and tests require detailed reading because a few of the questions were very specific.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: There are discussion posts every week but they are simple enough if you do the readings. The quizzes are also simple because they are multiple choice and they go over the events in the readings. Professor grades in a timely manner so you do not have to stress about waiting on grades.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: Easy class!!! Discussions due every week never used textbook used spark notes the entire semester. Open quizzes and exam. Not a hard grader.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Workplace Writing with Terry Carter was an enjoyable peek into the intricacies of writing in professional settings. There were many valuable lessons taught by Dr. Carter on various work-related topics, and every lesson carried a great amount of weight and importance. I am happy to have learned these lessons as I look toward beginning my career!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Really nice Professor. The assignments are fairly easy if youre good a writing. Also the weekly quizzes are extremely easy so as long as you stay on top of your assignments this class will be an easy A

As long as you put effort into this class, you'll have no worry about passing. Nothing will jump out at you as homework is routine every week. Expect a weekly discussion post with replies and a quiz, sometimes a short solo PowerPoint project. If you have any issues, reach out as he is quick to respond.

Honestly always forgot I was in this class. Barely any work- easy quiz every week and discussion post min of 200 words. This class was a breeeeeze. I hardly read what we were supposed to read and almost got a 100% in the class. Take it if you want a relaxed easy class.

Pretty easy class., took online. Discussion Post with reply once a week and a short 10 question quiz once a week. There is a midterm and a final which are pretty easy. Just do the work and it should be an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Carters course was straight forward. We knew our expectations and were held to them from the syllabus. I missed a few quizzes (by my own fault) and received a B+, but am happy with this grade. The other grading was extremely fair. Would definitely take Dr. Carter again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Each week, you read something new and write a 200 word paragraph about what you read. If youre a good student and messed up in one post and he will give you extra time to re-do it. Theres seven reading quizzes, a final writing assignment and a final based off of the majority of the readings through the semester.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Awesome professor, took his online class. Cares about your experience and the class is easy going and very interesting. If you read the material and post and reply to the 200 word discussion post then you are all set! There is a one essay at the end, a midterm, and final.

She does the most for an online gen ed class. Your original discussion posts & replies have to be approved by her before you can post and she can take 2-3 days to approve. Weekly readings and discussion posts. 6 easy quizzes. Midterm & final are easy. 2 -3 page final reflection essay is supposed to be easy but she grades it tough for no reason.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took online and was very easy. Discussion post once a week (about 200 words) and a quiz here and there, with lockdown browser w/o the camera... At the end of the semester, he offered extra credit where you could make up a quiz or discussion post you missed. The class was pretty easy going.
Great Professor, reasonable grading system. Uses lock down browser w/o webcam. Fulfilling lessons! I would recommend this professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: No idea if this semester was just a fluke or he was having a bad time or something but he was the most unhelpful professor I've ever had. When I had issues with the online assignments that couldn't be fixed by the IT folks he basically said too bad, it's your fault, do better. For my technical issues. Don't take him if you can avoid it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Easy summer online. 1 discussion post, two discussion replies, and 1 or 2 quizzes a week. 1 powerpoint presentation at the end. A midterm and final test, both of which are very easy. Just keep up with the tasks, but there's a pattern and the assignments are easy. Everything is based off the book, so DEFINITELY get the book.

I took this course as an 8 week summer course and it was the perfect choice. Dr. Carter lays out his class and quizzes/exams so that they aren't too difficult. He does stagger start and stop dates so you can't sit down in one day and finish all assignments, but that was the most difficult thing about this class. I would definitely take him again!

Very easy class - read the chapters, do the assignments, pass with an A.  The majority of the class is weekly writing (maybe 30-60 minutes worth of work).  The chapters in the textbook were short and easy to digest and the test questions came directly from the textbook.  Final assignment was a very simple PowerPoint project.
I took this class online and it wasn't bad at all. You NEED your textbook for every assignment and quiz. Lots of reading. Fair grader and very understanding. Do all your work and you'll pass.
There was a lot of reading and writing in this class but if you do the assigned readings, you shouldn't have any problems making an "A" out of this class. I highly recommend this professor.

Was a nice guy for the most part, but instead of answering questions, just directs you to the textbook. Grades based off of your draft instead of the quality of the paper. I'm the kind of person to write a paper, then revise that edition. Got Ds on both my papers that he said looked great. Swears by "Global Revision." Would not recommend.
There are only around five papers, but he was a tough grader for most of the class. Great guy, and very nice, but very passionate about English. I'd take again.
Very engaging professor just do the readings and the discussions and you will do great . He makes the class enterntaining with his personality
If you do the work, you'll make an A. Oh, you have to attend class too but thats the point of going to college. I studied and made an easy A.

Took him online - miserable experience.  Unclear instructions and he makes you spread out your work over the entire week which defeats the purpose of having the convenience of taking an online class.  You can't just do your work and be done with it - you have to post every day at least 150 word responses.  Very HARD research paper, harsh grader.
Horrible. Don't take him. He will tell you that your essay looks really good, then give you a D. He uses the Allyn & Bacon book like it is his bible. TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR.

His grading is ridiculous. I was actually told "Your first draft is too good, it will be hard for you to earn a good grade." I learned to succeed in his class, write a first draft, save it, and then rearrange everything, add typos, misspell words, take out ideas, and make things confusing. Undo it all for the final paper. Nice guy though!

Professor Carter is an excellent teacher.  He provides you with all the tools you need to succeed; you just need to be willing to put in the effort.  Really tremendous.  If you want to learn, then he's the professor to pick!  And, yes, revise your essays after a 1st draft and use online tutoring if you're taking his online class.

He had us do a lot of work from the book and a lot of journal entries, which made the class difficult. However, the essay assignments and stories we wrote were very easy to get a grasp of and get done. If you're a procrastinator, you probably should start getting work DONE if you want to pass this class. He recommends the ATTIC.

his online class consists of reading like a million pages a week and then writing a crapload of papers in addition to commenting on every single other person's discussions posted in class.  this class would be fine to take if this were the only class you were taking the entire semester.  he's actually a really nice guy in person though...

HE ASSIGNS A LOT OF READING EXPECTS TO MUCH FEED BACK ON THE BORING READINGS HIS CLASS IS A DISCUSSION CLASS-EASY DO MORE REPLIES THAN HE ASK FOR TO GET a A in his class which no one knew until it was to late most of your grade is just participation though and test online!!!

Great professor, highly recommended. Lots of work sometimes, because he grades more on revisions than ability. The ONLY way to do well is to heavily revise. I learned a great deal from his class, although I didn't realize it till later. What I've learned has helped me immensely in my profession, as well as other classes in school. Well worth it...

He is a very easy teacher as long as you do the work he gives you. He gives very few quizes. And he continuosly has you revise your essays before the final draft. When he grades the essay he mainly checks to see if there was a revision process. You will easily pass if you just do the homework.

he is an incredibly nice guy with a great character. the papers you have to write need constant revision, and it seems pointless at first but it really helps in the long run. He grades a little hard on the papers, because he expects a lot from the students. I didnt enjoy his class, but looking back I think I got a lot out of it.
Very cool teacher overall!
Awesome teacher, i don't care much for english class but he stresses the importance of it and makes it fun, and lots of interesting discussions, as long as you do the required work you will get an A
Hard teacher. You have to go through multiple drafts which are required to be changed drastically each essay before the final essay. Not recommended.
eh ok teacher one thing that was cool was his online  hybrid class. Easy class for the most part
He was an awesome teacher. I do not like english that much but as long as you do the work you can get a good grade.
Excellent personality. Not the most knowledgeable but teaches good and makes the class worth. A greath professor to have and he is very helpfull.
Just go to class, and explain to him your problems. Be sure to join in on discussions!
Good teacher.  He's very flexible in that if you miss a quiz or something he will let you make it up.  Be prepared to write a lot though.
Requires a lot of reading and writing, but he doesnt give tests or anything.  Pretty Easy
No Comments
